page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: The 'D' block is situated a little to the West of Reading.The largest urban area is the village of Pangbourne situated on the river Thames on the opposite bank from Whitchurch.There are two further villages in the block, Tidmarsh and Upper Basildon. Tidmarsh situated in the valley of the river Pang. Upper Basildon is up Pangbourne hill on the edge of the Berkshire Downs. The area is largely rural, containing farmland and woodland. In rural areas most of the housing is for those in the middle to upper income brackets, although there is a council estate, Wakeman's near Upper Basildon. The area is changing,both because of the building of the M4 motorway and the gradual expansion of nearby Reading. In most cases the surveyors received a warm welcome from the inhabitants.
